de.wwu.muggl.symbolic.searchAlgorithms.choice
Interface ChoicePoint

All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayInitializationChoicePoint, ConditionalJumpChoicePoint, ConditionalJumpChoicePointDepthFirst, DoubleComparisonChoicePoint, FloatComparisonChoicePoint, FpComparisonChoicePoint, GeneratorChoicePoint, LongComparisonChoicePoint, LookupswitchChoicePoint, SwitchingChoicePoint, TableswitchChoicePoint
public interface ChoicePoint

Interface for choice points. It defines methods to be implemented by any choice point used in this application. It hence has to be implemented by any concrete implementation, regardless of the number of possible jump targets or choices.

Choice points are not necessarily conditional jumps. Instructions that have choice points generated may not lead to jumps in the control flow at all or may even enforce jumping on any execution. Choice points are hence used to make sure execution will track back to them and something in the state space will change in comparison to the first pass before the execution is continued.

The typical life cycle of a choice point can be considered to be like this:

      1. Generation of the choice point with some initial values.
      2. Addition of further values.
      3. Continued execution with the first choice's state.
      4. Backtracking due to the end of the execution or another trigger.
      5. Checking if this choice point has another solution. => End of life if no solution is found. Control is given to the parent choice point.
      6. Restoring of the state that the machine was in when generating the choice point, before actually finishing execution of the choice point's instruction.
      7. Calling changeToNextChoice().
      8. Usage of the choice point to adapt the state to the situation after the choice point's instruction has been executed.
      9. Continued execution until 4. occurs.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-03-10
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Method Detail

getNumber

long getNumber()
Return this ChoicePoint's number.

Returns:
This ChoicePoint's number.

hasAnotherChoice

boolean hasAnotherChoice()
Indicates whether this choice point offers another choice. Initially, any choice point should return true as a choice point with only one choice is obsolete. Use changeToNextChoice() to change to this choice.

Returns:
true, if this choice point has another choice, false otherwise.

changeToNextChoice

void changeToNextChoice()
                        throws MugglException
Change to the next choice. This will change the internal state of this choice point only. For example, the ConstraintExpression returned by getConstraintExpression() might change or the action taken when applyStateChanges() is called could be adjusted.

Throws:
MugglException - If the change to the next choice failed. Implementing classes may not throw this exception. If they throw it, they should throw sub classes of it.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If there are no more choices.

getFrame

Frame getFrame()
Return the Frame of this ChoicePoint.

Returns:
The Frame of this ChoicePoint.

getPc

int getPc()
Return the pc of this ChoicePoint.

Returns:
The pc of this ChoicePoint.

getPcNext

int getPcNext()
Return the pc of the instruction directly following the choice point's instruction. It even is the directly following instruction of the execution of the choice point's instruction might lead to a jump. It however has to be the jump target if the choice point's instruction is an unconditional jump.

Returns:
The pc of the instruction directly following.

getParent

ChoicePoint getParent()
Return the parent of this ChoicePoint. The parent might be null, indicating that this is the root choice point.

Returns:
The parent of this ChoicePoint.

changesTheConstraintSystem

boolean changesTheConstraintSystem()
Indicates whether this choice point enforces changes to the constraint system. Choice points that represent conditional states will introduce constraints to the constraint sysytem and will need to have them removed on backtracking. Other choice point will possible work without changes to the constraint system.

Returns:
true, if this choice point enforces changes to the constraint system, false otherwise.

getConstraintExpression

de.wwu.testtool.expressions.ConstraintExpression getConstraintExpression()
Return the ConstraintExpression of this ChoicePoint. Be sure to use changesTheConstraintSystem() and receive true before calling this method.

Returns:
The ConstraintExpression of this ChoicePoint.

setConstraintExpression

void setConstraintExpression(de.wwu.testtool.expressions.ConstraintExpression constraintExpression)
Setter for the ConstraintExpression of this ChoicePoint.

Parameters:
constraintExpression - The new ConstraintExpression for this ChoicePoint.

hasTrail

boolean hasTrail()
Find out if this ChoicePoint has a trail.

Returns:
true, if this ChoicePoint has a trail, false otherwise.

Parameters:

enforcesStateChanges

boolean enforcesStateChanges()
Indicates whether this choice point enforces changes to the execution state. Suche changes include modifications of the local variables, method parameters and fields.

Returns:
true, if this choice point enforces changes to the execution state, false otherwise.

applyStateChanges

void applyStateChanges()
Apply any state changes required for the current choice.
